veloce:apexload.description: Loads data into org, by creation of Anonymous apex code and it's execution. Operation is working in two modes: Update only (default) and Upsert --upsert. After each batch SOQL query is performed and ID Map file is populated with OldId=>NewId mappings
examples: $ sfdx veloce:apexload -u gp01 -s PricebookEntry -i sfxId__c -f ./data/insert.csv

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sobjecttype.name: sobjecttype
sobjecttype.description: The sObject type of the records you want to upsert.

externalid.name: externalid
externalid.description: The column name of the external ID.

idreplacefields.name: idreplacefields
idreplacefields.description: Coma separated list of fields in which SF IDs are replaces by mapped Ids by using text search and replace

printids.name: printids
printids.description: Print External ID before attempting to update

upsert.name: upsert
upsert.description: Should use APEX upsert (could insert extra records) or update-only APEX (one by one), which is default

idmap.name: idmap
idmap.description: idmap.json file path, to store/load <csvId:targetId> pairs

ignorefields.name: ignorefields
ignorefields.description: Coma separated list of fields to ignore during load

batch.name: batch
batch.description: Size of batch, to avoid getting 'script is too large'

boolfields.name: boolfields
boolfields.description: Coma separated list of boolean fields

datefields.name: datefields
datefields.description: Coma separated list of date fields

numericfields.name: numericfields
numericfields.description: Coma separated list of boolean fields

veloce:dump.description: Dumps data from Object in org
examples:
$ sfdx veloce:dump -s Product2 -i 00Dxx000000001234 --targetusername myOrg@example.com --targetdevhubusername devhub@org.com
  Hello world! This is org: MyOrg and I will be around until Tue Mar 20 2018!
  My hub org id is: 00Dxx000000001234

$ sfdx veloce:dump -s Product2 -i 00Dxx000000001234 --targetusername myOrg@example.com
  Hello myname! This is org: MyOrg and I will be around until Tue Mar 20 2018!

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

append.name: append
append.description: Append mode ON: don't add CSV header row and append to existing file!

onlyfields.name: onlyfields
onlyfields.description: Coma separated list of fields to include in export

where.name: where
where.description: where condition to filter sObjects by

sobjecttype.name: sobjecttype
sobjecttype.description: The sObject type of the records you want to dump.

idmap.name: idmap
idmap.description: idmap.json file path, to REVERSE map IDs from

file.name: file
file.description: relative/full path to file to write CSV into

ignorefields.name: ignorefields
ignorefields.description: Coma separated list of fields to ignore during dump

idreplacefields.name: idreplacefields
idreplacefields.description: Coma separated list of fields in which SF IDs are replaces by mapped Ids by using text search and replace

veloce:dumpcontentdoc.description: Dumps data from Document in org
examples: $ sfdx veloce:dumpcontentdoc -i 01521000000gHgnAAE -o file.pml --targetusername myOrg@example.com --targetdevhubusername devhub@org.com
$ sfdx veloce:dumpcontentdoc -i 01521000000gHgnAAE -o file.pml --name myname --targetusername myOrg@example.com

  My hub org id is: 00Dxx000000001234

veloce:packrules.description: Copy rules to csv for salesforce import
examples: $ sfdx veloce:pack -i rules -o VELOCPQ__PriceRule__c.csv -m pgmap.json

pgmap.description: Price group configuration map file to map rule to price group

veloce:packui.description: Embeds attached files and creates self-contained json
examples: $ sfdx veloce:packui --inputdir . -n BOARDING --outputfile metadata_new.json
